alert.note: Alert for Cassia; Power (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 3:19PM MDT until August 13 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following counties, Cassia, Oneida and Power. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, and well as in basements. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported very heavy rain from multiple slow moving thunderstorms in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Thunderstorms are trending southeast, but flooding is likely to continue over the next hour even in areas where heavy rainfall has ended. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malta, Juniper, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Elba, Almo, Sublett Reservoir, Sweetzer Summit, Roy, Bridge, Arbon, Pauline and eastern City Of Rocks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Find an alternate route. Please report flooding or debris flows to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, when it is safe to do so.
